The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves complex processes including cutting-edge manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA collaborates closely with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations in Arizona.

In the next four years, NVIDIA aims to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure, working with partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships enhance NVIDIA's global footprint, create new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit:

Over the next four years, NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure. edit target content:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves complex processes including cutting-edge manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA collaborates closely with industry leaders Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations in Arizona.

In the next four years, NVIDIA aims to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure, working with partners such as TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships enhance NVIDIA's global footprint, create new business opportunities, and strengthen supply chain resilience.
content after edit:
The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain involves multiple advanced stages: manufacturing, packaging, assembly, and testing. NVIDIA partners with leading industry players Amkor and SPIL, particularly for packaging and testing activities in Arizona.

Over the next four years, NVIDIA plans to invest up to $500 billion in U.S.-based AI infrastructure. This investment is in collaboration with key partners including TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships significantly expand NVIDIA's global reach, drive new business opportunities, and reinforce supply chain resilience.
